chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
All charges against Sheri Lynne Schroeder in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sheri Lynne Schroeder is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:37 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Sheri Lynne Schroeder in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Sheri Lynne Schroeder.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Erickson is heard. They're ready to proceed with plea and sentencing. Attorney Erickson is heard on agreement. 

21CF97 Dismissed, 22CF08 Dismissed. 

21CF95
Ct 1 - 961.41(3g)(g) - Possession of Methamphetamine (1) No Contest; 12 month jail, court costs
Ct 2 - 343.44(1)(b) - Operating While Revoked (1) No Contest; Fine $200.00 plus costs

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the constitutional and fundamental rights with Defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the elements of the charge with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the minimum / maximum penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 

Court asks defendant for plea. Defendant enters a plea of no contest. Court accepts the defendants no contest plea and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters plea. Court finds the defendant guilty of count 1 and count 2 in 21CF95. 

State is heard on sentencing. State moves to dismiss 21CF97 and  21CF08. Court dismisses both cases.  
Attorney Erickson is heard on sentencing and requests probation plus time to report. 
Defendant is heard. Requests Electronic Monitoring. 

Court orders for 21CF95

Ct 1 - 961.41(3g)(g) - Possession of Methamphetamine (1) No Contest; 12 month jail, credit for good time. Huber/Electronic Monitoring approved. Report to jail on or before Nov 9 @ 6:30 PM. $518.00 Court costs. 
No Jail credit. 

Ct 2 - 343.44(1)(b) - Operating While Revoked (1) No Contest; Fine $200.00 plus costs. Total $705.00

Total of $1,223.00. $500.00 Bond to be applied.  After bond is applied the total is $723.00

Atty Erickson is heard. Approaches bench with preliminary hearing waiver. 
Court reviews preliminary questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 

Atty Erickson is heard and is ready to proceed with arraignment today. Information brought over. 
Atty Erickson waives further formal reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each of the two counts.
